headline: Italian Sausage and Gnocchi Skillet
description: Sausage, gnocchi, tomatoes, and spinach are the main ingredients in this one-skillet meal that comes together easily. A quick, comforting recipe.
name: Italian Sausage and Gnocchi Skillet
recipeIngredient: 1 pound mild Italian pork sausage, casing removed
1 (16 ounce) package dry mini potato gnocchi

recipeInstructions.text: Heat avocado oil in a large, nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add onion and cook until softened, 3 to 4 minutes. Add garlic and cook just until fragrant, about 30 seconds. Add sausage; stir to break up the meat and cook until well browned, 5 to 7 minutes.
Drain excess oil and keep meat mixture in the skillet. Add gnocchi, stirring to break up any clumps. Stir in tomatoes, salt, basil, oregano, and pepper. Cover and simmer for 5 minutes.

Stir in spinach and nutmeg and simmer until spinach has wilted, 3 to 5 minutes. Sprinkle mozzarella and Parmesan cheeses on top, cover, and simmer until cheese has melted, 2 to 3 minutes. Serve immediately.

review.reviewBody: Test tasted before adding the shredded Mozzarella. Thought it was perfect without it. Great recipe!

This recipe is amazing! I made this for my family, and they absolutely loved it. This recipe is so easy and delicious. I made a few changes, but it still came out wonderful. Instead of using store bought Gnocchi, I made mine homemade. I will be making this more often because it's one of my family's favorites. Thanks for this amazing recipe!

Amazing AND quick and easy! Because I didn’t use fresh, chopped tomatoes - I used a 14oz can……and because I didn’t think there was enough liquid to “simmer” the gnocchi, made a split second decision and added a second, 14oz can - which was perfect. When I added the second can, also added an extra 1/2 tsp of basil/oregano (1 tsp total). Huge hit, huge flavor and super simple to make! Will make on my busy night winter rotation! Thanks Bren!

Made this afternoon. Used what had on hand= chicken/apple sausage, and cabbage instead of spinach. Also had cauliflower and spinach gnocchi in freezer. And cheese- Swiss and Parm. Going to warm some up for dinner and add some hot sauce, don't know what kind yet...

I honestly used the recipe as a starting point as I have very limited time to get dinner fixed and on the table. I followed the first step exactly then I added a jar of marinara sauce and 8 oz of tomato sauce let it cook together while I defrosted a box of frozen spinach, squeezed out the water and added I to the skillet with a dash of nutmeg. Stirred it all together topped it with the cheese,covering until melted. It was delicious! This is the first time I've had gnocchi that wasn't boiled then sauced.

Just made this for the first time. I had frozen gnocchi, so I used that and I used two (14 1/2 oz.) cans of diced tomatoes instead of 2 1/2 cups. Omg, it was fabulous! My family absolutely loved it! There is a little leftover and I’ll bet it’s even better the next day. Thank you so much for sharing such an easy and excellent recipe. This is one of our faves now!
I made this with gemeli pasta and it was delicious!
Quick and easy meal. Didn’t change a thing and my family said it was a keeper. Thanks for sharing.

Easy, fast and delicious. I used frozen cauliflower gnocchi and didn’t add the mozzarella. 
I also made homemade chicken sausage from this site.
Not too crazy about gnocchi, but was tasty. I think I would use pasta next time. An easy meal for a weeknight.

Five stars plus! This was sooo good! I used diced tomatoes that had salt. Wish I had followed the recipe and used "no added salt" tomatoes. It was a little salty but still excellent. Will be making again.

This was so much better than I thought it could be. 
We happened to have Gnocchi. Frozen made from cauliflower. Terrific!!
I didn't have mozzarella so left that out and it was still delicious.
We loved it! I added more diced tomato's and onions than the recipe called for. Personally, I didn't think it needed the mozzarella. I Will definitely make this dish again!

This was a great flavorful dish for sure!!!
A keeper!!!
GR8 flavor and easy to make.
This was a big hit and leftovers even better. Will make this one again and serve guests.
delicious! my husband is very picky and hates veggies but he ate all of this!
Delicious and so easy. I used ground turkey Italian sausage instead of chicken Italian sausage and frozen cauliflower. I topped with grated parmesan when serving.
Delicious! I used whole wheat gnocchi and otherwise made as directed. We'll definitely be making this again. Delicious and absolutely comfort food!
Healthy, easy, and super tasty! Feel free to add more spinach; chop into small pieces beforehand.

Super easy to make and very easy clean up. Even better, it was an absolute hit with my husband. I think he had three servings. We both had it for lunch today - as with many dishes like this, it was even better the next day. Highly recommend!
Will make this again.

This is a very good Gnocchi dish, we really liked it.
I used mild Italian Sausage and San Marzano tomatoes.
The San Marzano tomatoes don’t have water in them so I was a bit short on liquid. I added some water to the can to scrape out the can and it worked great.
The flavours are wonderful, all in all delicious.
Thank you for another great recipe and another way to make 
Gnocchi.
Oct.19/2019
